statement.para: The addition of matrices has the following properties

info.caption: Associativity of matrix addition
info.para: The associativity property of matrix addition is the identity

info.caption: Associativity of matrix addition
info.para: The associativity property of matrix addition is the identity

info.caption: Commutativity of matrix addition
info.para: The commutativity property of matrix addition is the identity

info.caption: Commutativity of matrix addition
info.para: The commutativity property of matrix addition is the identity

part.para: (-1)\cdot A is the additive inverse of A

proof.para: Addition of matrices is defined by adding the matrix entries in matching positions. Therefore the above identities for matrix sums follow directly from the corresponding identities for sums of real numbers. – The details follow.
proof.caption: Associativity Associativity
proof.para: Suppose A, B, and C are three matrices of size (m,n). Let us work with the entries in position (i,j) for some fixed 1\leq i\leq m and 1\leq j\leq n. Suppose

li.para: A has the number a_{ij} in position (i,j)
B has the number b_{ij} in position (i,j)
C has the number c_{ij} in position (i,j)

proof.para: Now let’s look at the entry in position (i,j) of the two matrix sums in question:

li.para: A+(B+C) has the number a_{ij}+(b_{ij}+c_{ij}) in position (i,j)

proof.para: These two numbers are equal because of the associativity law for the addition of real numbers. – This result applies to each position. Therefore the two matrix sums are equal, and the associativity property of matrix addition is proven.
proof.caption: Commutativity Commutativity
proof.para: Again let's look at the entry in position (i,j) of the two matrix sums in question.

li.para: A+B has the number a_{ij}+b_{ij} in position (i,j)
B+A has the number b_{ij}+a_{ij} in position (i,j)

proof.para: These two numbers are equal because of the commutativity law for the addition of real numbers. – This result applies to each position. Therefore the two matrix sums are equal, and the associativity property of matrix addition is proven.
The remaining properties of matrix addition can be proved with the same method. – Try it!
